  • Constructor Details

    • MainWindowController

      public MainWindowController()
      The MainWindowController function is the constructor for the MainWindowController class. It initializes all the properties that are used in this class, including: lastWord, playerAction, placedTiles and startGame. It also calls two other functions to initialize more properties: initializeTileProperties() and initializeNameProperties(). These functions are explained below.

  • Method Details

    • initializeTileProperties

      public void initializeTileProperties()
      The initializeTileProperties function initializes the tile properties for each of the seven tiles. It sets their text to be blank and their score to be 0.

    • initializeBoardAction

      public void initializeBoardAction()
      The initializeBoardAction function is responsible for initializing the board action. It does this by creating a new SimpleStringProperty and binding it to the cellLabel property of the viewModel. The function then adds a listener to that property, which updates the boardCellLabel whenever there is an update in that property.

    • initializeViewModelUpdates

      public void initializeViewModelUpdates()
      The initializeViewModelUpdates function is responsible for initializing the viewModelUpdates property. The viewModelUpdates property is a StringProperty that holds the current state of the View Model's updates. This function binds this StringProperty to a new SimpleStringProperty, which in turn is bound to another SimpleStringProperty held by the View Share Data object. This second SimpleStringProperty holds all * the updates from our View Model and will be updated whenever there are changes made to it by our Controller class.

    • bindButtonsProperties

      public void bindButtonsProperties()
      The bindButtonsProperties function binds the visibility of the buttons to their respective properties in viewShareData.getViewModel().submit, viewShareData.getViewModel().resign, and viewShareData.getViewModel().skipTurn

    • bindPlayerProperties

      public void bindPlayerProperties()
      The bindPlayerProperties function binds the player names and scores to their respective text fields. This allows for the view to be updated when a player's name or score changes.

    • bindTilesProperties

      public void bindTilesProperties()
      The bindTilesProperties function binds the text properties of each tile to the corresponding property in the view model. This allows for changes made to these properties in the view model to be reflected on screen.

    • initializeHostAction

      public void initializeHostAction()
      The initializeHostAction function is called when the user clicks on the "Host" button. It sets up a new game, and then calls initializeGameAction to start it.

    • initializePlayerAction

      public void initializePlayerAction()
      The initializePlayerAction function is used to bind the playerAction and lastWord properties of the viewShareData's ViewModel to their respective properties in this class. This allows for changes made in either property to be reflected on both sides.

    • Submit

      public void Submit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The Submit function is called when the user clicks on the Submit button. It calls buildWord() to create a string of all letters in the word, then sets playerAction to "Submit," + lastWord. This will be read by GameController, which will check if it's a valid word and update scores accordingly.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • resetWordParameters

      public void resetWordParameters()
      The resetWordParameters function clears the placedTiles ArrayList and sets playerWord to an empty string. This function is called after a word has been successfully played, so that the next word can be played.

    • ReloadTiles

      public void ReloadTiles(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The ReloadTiles function is called when the user clicks on the "Reload Tiles" button. It sets playerAction to "reset", which resets all of the tiles in play, and then it sets playerAction to "SwapTiles", which swaps out any tiles that are not currently in play.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • ShuffleTiles

      public void ShuffleTiles(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The ShuffleTiles function is used to shuffle the tiles in a random order. It does this by collecting all the VBox elements from the HBox, shuffling them, and then adding them back to the HBox.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • SkipTurn

      public void SkipTurn(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The SkipTurn function is called when the user clicks on the Skip Turn button. It sets playerAction to "reset" and then to "SkipTurn". This allows for a reset of any previous action that was set, and then it sets playerAction to "SkipTurn", which will be read by the game engine in order for it to skip over this players turn. The function also closes out of this window after setting playerAction so that we can return into our main game window.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • Resign

      public void Resign(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The Resign function is called when the user clicks on the Resign button. It displays a confirmation alert to make sure that the user wants to resign, and if they do, it exits out of the game.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the action
      Throws:
      IOException

    • StartTutorial

      public void StartTutorial(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The StartTutorial function is called when the user clicks on the "Tutorial" button. It loads a new scene, which displays a tutorial for how to play the game.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • StartAsHost

      public void StartAsHost(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The StartAsHost function is called when the user clicks on the "Start as Host" button. It checks if all the fields are valid, and if they are, it sets up a connection to localhost (the host's own computer) and launches BookScrabbleCommunication. If any of the fields aren't valid, an error message appears next to that field.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • toggleStartButton

      public void toggleStartButton()
      The toggleStartButton function is used to toggle the visibility of the startGame button. This function is called when a game has ended, and it allows for another game to be started.

    • StartAsGuest

      public void StartAsGuest(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The StartAsGuest function is called when the user clicks on the "Start as Guest" button. It checks if all the fields are valid, and if they are, it connects to a server with GameMode.Guest (which means that this client will be a guest). If any of the fields aren't valid, then an error message appears next to each invalid field. The function also loads up BoardViewController's FXML file and sets viewShareData's host variable to false (since this client is not hosting).
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • connectToServer

      public void connectToServer(GameMode gameMode)
      The connectToServer function is responsible for creating a new model and setting it to the viewModel. It also creates a new GameManagerReceiver, which will be used by the client to receive messages from the server. The function then initializes both hostAction and playerAction, which are used in order to send messages from client to server.
      Parameters:
      gameMode - Determine whether the client is a host or not

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      The startGame function is called when the host presses the start game button. It sends a message to all clients that they should begin playing.

    • loadHostForm

      public void loadHostForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The loadHostForm function is called when the user clicks on the "Host" button. It loads a new scene, which is the HostPage.fxml file, and displays it to the user.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • loadHomePage

      public void loadHomePage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The loadHomePage function is used to load the HomePage scene when the user clicks on the "Home" button. It takes an ActionEvent as a parameter, and returns nothing.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the event
      Throws:
      IOException

    • loadGuestForm

      public void loadGuestForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The loadGuestForm function is called when the user clicks on the "Guest" button. It loads a new scene, which is the GuestPage.fxml file, and displays it to the user.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the action
      Throws:
      IOException

    • loadBoard

      public void loadBoard(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The loadBoard function is called when the user clicks on the "Board" button. It loads a new scene, which displays all of the boards that are currently available to be viewed by this user. The BoardPageController class handles all of these actions.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the action private void loadscene(actionevent event, string scenename) throws ioexception { parent root = fxmlloader
      Throws:
      IOException

    • Exit

      public void Exit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      The Exit function is called when the user clicks on the Exit button. It displays a confirmation alert to make sure that the user wants to exit, and if they do, it exits out of the game.
      Parameters:
      event - Get the source of the action
      Throws:
      IOException

    • BackToHomePage

      public void BackToHomePage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException

      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • validPort

      public boolean validPort(String port)
      The validPort function checks to see if the port number is valid.

      Parameters:
      port - Check if the port number is valid
      Returns:
      True if the port is a valid port number, and false otherwise

    • validIp

      public boolean validIp(String ip)
      The validIp function takes a String as an argument and returns true if the string is a valid IP address.

      Parameters:
      ip - Check if the ip address is valid
      Returns:
      True if the string is a valid ip address

    • validName

      public boolean validName(String name)
      The validName function checks to see if the name entered by the user is valid.

      Parameters:
      name - Check if the string contains only letters
      Returns:
      True if the name is valid

    • squareClickHandler

      public void squareClickHandler()
      The squareClickHandler function is used to make the tiles draggable. It also removes a tile from the board if it is clicked on.

    • setViewShareData

      public void setViewShareData(ViewShareData viewShareData)
      The setViewShareData function is used to set the viewShareData variable in this class.

      Parameters:
      viewShareData - Pass data from the viewsharedata class to this class
